title: Wasim Akram
summary: Wasim  Akram (born 3 June 1966) is a Pakistani cricket commentator, coach, and former cricketer and captain of the Pakistan national cricket team. Known as the "King of Reverse Swing" or the "Sultan of Swing", Akram is regarded as one of the greatest fast bowlers in the history of cricket.[1][2][3][4][5][6][7] In October 2013, Wasim Akram was the only Pakistani cricketer to be named in an all-time Test World XI to mark the 150th anniversary of Wisden Cricketers' Almanack.[8][9][10][11]
